Class FileConfiguration

  • public class FileConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    Loads lots and lots of various strings/properties from there appropriate files
    Author:
    Timothy

      • load

        public void load()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        Loads all the necessary configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an io-exception occurs (or a file is not found)
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if a required key is missing

      • loadProperties

        protected java.util.Properties loadProperties(java.io.File file,
                                  java.lang.String... requiredKeys)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              java.lang.NullPointerException
        Loads properties from the specified file, as if by Properties.load(java.io.Reader)
        Parameters:
        file - the file to load from
        requiredKeys - the list of required keys
        Returns:
        the properties in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an i/o exception occurs (like file not existing)
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if a required key is missing or the file is null

      • loadReplyString

        protected java.lang.String loadReplyString(java.io.File file)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a reply string from a file, ignoring lines prefixed with a hash-tag (#). Any empty lines prior to the first non-empty line are ignored. Lines are separated Unix-like (only \n)
        Parameters:
        file - the file to load from
        Returns:
        the reply format
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an i/o exception occurs, like the file not existing

      • loadStringList

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> loadStringList(java.io.File file)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a list of strings from the file, where there is 1 string per line. Lines prefixed with /u/ are modified as if by String.substring(int) with parameter 3. All strings are lower-cased.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to load from
        Returns:
        each line in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an i/o exception occurs, like the file not existing

      • getBannedUsers

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getBannedUsers()
        Returns:
        the list of banned users, lower-case and not prefixed with /u/
